--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Gord=
on Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:
>
> If you set the 'source-tag-seeds' setting o=
f your Frontier to 'true', 
> each seed URI will be tagged with itself, and=
 then each URI discovered 
> from those seeds will inherit this same source=
 seed. This source tag 
> will appear in the second-to-last field of the cr=
awl.log.
> 
> So, you'll be able to see from the crawl.log the seed from wh=
ich any
URI 
> was discovered.
> 
> Note that it's not guaranteed to be the=
 seed from which the shortest 
> path to the URI can be found -- the crawle=
r sometimes follows
longer-hop 
> paths more quickly than shorter-hop paths=
, and the source tag will be 
> the seed from which the URi was actually di=
scovered.
> 
> (The above is true for 1.14.1; it looks like a bug in 2.0.1 =
is 
> preventing the source tag from appearing in the crawl.log.)
> 
> - Go=
rdon @ IA
>
